page.title: 18Biography; Upton Snodsbury.
page.content:
Mr. Tom Camden is probably the best known resident of Upton Snodsbury. He was awarded the M.B.E. on his retirement after over 50 years service to the local community. He served on the County Council and as clerk to the parish council for 45 years. He was a church warden for 46 years and a bell ringer.
Margaret Tarran a local farmers wife from Broughton Hackett is a well known flower artist whose paintings have been exhibited at the Three Choirs Festival in Worcester and also in a Broadway gallery. She has executed commissions for a large number of charities. She most enjoys recording the flora of the Worcestershire countryside.
